basics.name: Mason Daugherty
basics.label: Student, Bowdoin College
basics.summary: I'm a Texan-turned-Mainer, currently studying Computer Science and Digital & Computational Studies at Bowdoin College, graduating in 2025. I have passion for problem-solving and utilizing effective storytelling to simplify complex ideas.

work.name: Teens to Trails
work.description: Nonprofit connecting Maine teens to the outdoors
work.summary: Nonprofit connecting Maine teens to the outdoors
highlights: Engineered and wrote Node.js and Python scripts for serverless integrations & automations, leveraging APIs to streamline workflows and reduce manual data entry tasks that saved 6 hours weekly

Spearheaded the implementation of Apple Business Essentials for Zero-Touch MDM Deployment of new machines, automating setup with federated authentication and security-first configuration profiles and apps, reducing setup time by 60%
Designed and rolled out a project management tool, leading training sessions and providing ongoing support, resulting in a 95% adoption rate and improved cross-departmental collaboration and planning

work.name: WBOR 91.1 FM

Re-engineered broadcast signal chain with modern audio compression codecs optimized for web delivery
Oversee 200+ student & community volunteer DJs, supervise station broadcast equipment and facilities

Used Confluence to write 32,5000 words of operational documentation (best practices, admin tool guidelines, software maintenance & troubleshooting, recurring processes & procedures, organizational philosophy)
Oversee 200+ student & community DJs, supervise station broadcast equipment and facilities
Compile quarterly reports to be submitted on behalf of Bowdoin College to the Federal Communications Commission
Engage 100% of the 1,100+ recorded WBOR Alumni

Gained hands-on experience with critical back-end systems, including 1Password, Okta, and Workday
